definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with
to do things in a strictly businesslike manner (idiom)
conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly

sentences.english: Business is business . You have to pay the bill.
sentences.chinese: 公事公辦，妳是要付賬的。

sentences.english: The fixed assets of public university are important parts of state-owned fixed assets.
sentences.chinese: 公辦高校固定資產是國有資產的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: She told him in a curt and businesslike manner.
sentences.chinese: 她以一種簡潔和公事公辦的方式通知他。

sentences.english: Some people prefer to simply get down to business when at the office.
sentences.chinese: 有些人在上班的時候更喜歡公事公辦。

sentences.english: Business is business . One can't too particular.
sentences.chinese: 公事公辦，誰也不能特殊。

sentences.english: Privately-run schools have the equal legal status of public schools.
sentences.chinese: 民辦學校與公辦學校具有同等的法律地位。

sentences.english: As a leader, he must handle a matter impartially.
sentences.chinese: 作爲領導，他必須秉公辦事。

definition: ability to make one's own decisions
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
